arguments.claim: Retracted confession can form basis of conviction if voluntary, true, and generally corroborated

anchor.surface_text: The question has very often arisen whether a retracted confession may form the basis of conviction if believed to be true and voluntarily made. arguments.claim: General corroboration sufficient for retracted confession, unlike accomplice needing material particulars

anchor.surface_text: Though under s. 133 of the Evidence Act a conviction is not illegal merely because it proceeds on the uncorroborated testimony of witnesses, illustration b to s. 114 lays down that a court may presume that an accomplice is unworthy of credit unless he is corroborated in material particulars.
